item.title: AMATH Prof Talk
item.description:
Come join us for an AMATH Prof Talk on neural networks and dynamical systems!
Abstract: In machine learning, neural networks are often used in a feed-forward manner. Or, when a population of neurons is recurrently connected, the updates happen in synchronized jumps. But the neurons in your brain are operating in continuous time. I will show you some ways to bridge the gap to biology, and treat networks of interconnected neurons as a dynamical system. Then, we'll co-opt those networks to do our bidding, and get them to solve dynamical systems.
Pizza and refreshments will be provided to PMC members.

item.title: Maaveerar Naal: Our Heroes, Our Legacy
item.description:
In honour of the fallen heroes of the Tamileelam community, UWATNA and LUTSA dedicate the month of November to remember and pay tribute to their sacrifices made for the freedom and progress of our people. Each year, Tamils around the world unite in this month of remembrance to celebrate the courage and resilience of our Maaveerars.
The University of Waterloo Tamil Networking Association (UWATNA), in collaboration with the Laurier University Tamil Students‚Äô Association (LUTSA), invites you to our Campus Maaveerar Naal Commemoration Ceremony, ‚ÄòOur Heroes, Our Legacy,‚Äô time to reflect, remember, and honour the enduring legacy of our heroes whose bravery, sacrifice, and unity continue to inspire generations of Tamils worldwide
üóìÔ∏è | Wednesday, November 19th, 2025‚Ä®‚è∞ | 7:00 PM ‚Äì 9:00 PM‚Ä®üìç | Black and Gold Room, University of Waterloo‚Ä®üëî | Please wear black to show solidarity
Let us come together to pay our respects to those who gave everything for our freedom, and ensure their legacy lives on forever.

item.title: From Outages to Ownership
item.description:
From Outages to Ownership: Disaster Recovery, DNS, and Career Journeys in Okta Engineering
Ready to see how a top tech company handles the really big challenges? Join us and our Okta engineers for an evening focused on the critical work that keeps our services running; even when major outages happen. Our Staff Software Engineer will kick off the event with a fascinating technical talk, diving into DNS, redundancy, and disaster recovery based on her real-world experience at Okta. It‚Äôs a timely look at how engineering teams build for reliability at scale.
After the deep-dive, you‚Äôll hear from a panel of Engineers from various teams as they share their own career paths, offer a peek into their day-to-day work, and give you practical advice for launching your career. Stick around for our informal networking mixer to connect one-on-one with the team and ask any final questions!
üîó Link in bio to register

item.title: Women‚Äôs Centre X Glow Centre Chest Casting Workshop
item.description:
Join the Women‚Äôs Centre and Glow on Friday, November 21 in the Women‚Äôs Centre (SLC 3104) for an event celebrating your body in a safe environment! Create a plaster cast of your chest as a way to honour and connect with your body.
No matter the size and shape of your bust, every woman-identifying person and non-binary-identifying person is welcome at the event!
There will also be a discussion on the sexualization and feminization of chests, and how these narratives can perpetuate transphobia and body image issues. Together, we‚Äôll explore new ways of seeing our bodies to help foster more positive and affirming self-perception.
Three FREE sessions are available: 11AM ‚Äì 12 PM 1 PM ‚Äì 2 PM 3 PM ‚Äì 4 PM* Glow Centre ‚Äì run session
Registration will be open from November 3 through November 21 at 3 p.m., or until all available spots are filled. Please register early to secure your place using the link below!
‚ö†Ô∏è Accessibility, Comfort & Health Notice
This is a messy craft activity using paper m√¢ch√© materials, so please wear clothes you don‚Äôt mind getting dirty.
Participants will remove clothing from their upper body in a small, private group setting (about 10 people). We understand this can feel vulnerable ‚Äî please know it‚Äôs a safe and body-positive space, and you can opt out or pause at any time.
If you have allergies, skin sensitivities, or accessibility needs, please contact us in advance so we can make accommodations.
This event is exclusive to Waterloo undergrad students.

item.title: University of Waterloo Accounting Conference 2025
item.description:
The UWAC Team is thrilled to announce that registration for UWAC 2025 is now open! Register for a chance to compete for cash prizes, build valuable skills through sponsor-led workshops, and connect with students and industry professionals at Canada‚Äôs leading undergraduate accounting conference! The conference will take place on Saturday, November 22nd, hosted at Hagey Hall on the University of Waterloo campus.
Teams will consist of four members, and you can either register with a group of friends or let us assign you a team. The registration deadline is FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 7TH at 11:59 PM, but sign up before November 2nd to take advantage of our early bird pricing and save $10!
Early bird pricing (until November 2nd): $20 Regular pricing: $30
Sign up by paying for the ticket on the WUSA website AND submitting your application using our Google Form (https://forms.gle/zucuboQK1KwnkXKs9). You must complete BOTH forms to officially register! Spots are limited and will be assigned on a first-come, first-served basis, so make sure every team member signs up!
For any questions or concerns, reach out to us at info@uwac.ca or through our social media. We can‚Äôt wait to see you at the conference on November 22nd!

item.title: Voices Empower Walk
item.description: Join us for the Voices Empower Walk on November 22. Meet at the UWaterloo ION Station at 12:20 PM or at Uptown Square before 1 PM. The event runs from 1‚Äì4 PM. Everyone is welcome. Every six days in Canada, a woman is killed by her intimate partner. In 2024 alone, 187 femicides were recorded nationwide 62 in Ontario between November 2023 and November 2024. This rise in violence demands action. We cannot stay silent. When we walk together, we honor those lost, stand with survivors, and raise funds to help women, gender-diverse people, and children move beyond violence. Together, we walk for change. üíú

item.title: Speak Your Truth Palestine Open Mic
item.description: Meet us at the SLC Student Lounge at the University of Waterloo campus on November 27th, at 7PM! Join us for a @staywokeevent @wlupjc @uwvfp @mesalaurier @nasawaterloo collaboration open-mic where we encourage you to Speak Your Truth on all things Palestine üáµüá∏ We invite you all to find community during this time as we are filled with grief, anger, sadness and utter horror for what we are witnessing in Gaza. Performer and attendee registration link is in our bio. üé§ Drinks will be provided by @rommana.cafe ‚òïÔ∏è Registration will close November 25th at 11:59PM, and performer applicants will receive confirmations by the 26th. Performance topics must be related to Palestine. There is no ticket fee and all UWaterloo and Laurier students, alumni, and community members are welcome to attend!
